meanings.definition: A device that can both transmit and receive signals.
meanings.sent1: The transceivers in our phones allow us to make calls and send messages.
meanings.sent2: The military uses advanced transceivers for secure communication.
meanings.sent3: The transceivers at the party seemed to gossip with each other.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like transceivers, picking up every subtle emotion in the room.
meanings.sent5: The transceivers on the spaceship were crucial for maintaining contact with Earth.

meanings.definition: The equipment used for communication between two points.
meanings.sent1: We installed transceivers on the towers to improve our network coverage.
meanings.sent2: The transceivers on the boats helped them stay connected during the race.
meanings.sent3: The transceivers whispered secrets to each other in the dark room.
meanings.sent4: Their love was like transceivers, always in sync no matter the distance.
meanings.sent5: The transceivers on the mountain peaks relayed messages across the valley.
